abstract.t: In the daily communication between technicians, engineers and otherpeople who need to deal with computer networks, it is often necessaryto refer to particular parts of IP addresses. In the world of IPv4,the term "octet" is well established, however as the use of IPv6 isspreading, it becomes apparent that there is no such commonlyaccepted term for IPv6 addresses.Discussing and explaining technical matters become difficult whendifferent people use different terms for the same thing. Therefore,this document discusses several naming proposal for those 16bitpieces of IPv6 addreses.
